To simplify the expression √(27/16), we will find the square root of both the numerator and the denominator separately.

√27 = √(3^3) = 3√3 (since 27 is 3 raised to the power of 3)

√16 = √(4^2) = 4 (since 16 is 4 raised to the power of 2)

Now, we can write the simplified expression as:

√(27/16) = (3√3)/4
